meanings.definition: The quality or state of being level.
meanings.sent1: The levelness of the table made it easy to place the vase without it tipping over.
meanings.sent2: The levelness of the ground made it perfect for setting up the tent.
meanings.sent3: The levelness of the cake made it look like a professional baker had made it.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor matched the levelness of the lake on a windless day.
meanings.sent5: The levelness of the road made for a smooth and comfortable ride.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is level.
meanings.sent1: The levelness of the shelf was crucial to prevent items from falling off.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter checked the levelness of the floor before installing the new tiles.
meanings.sent3: The levelness of the playing field gave both teams an equal chance to win.
meanings.sent4: The levelness of her voice indicated she was telling the truth.
meanings.sent5: The levelness of the horizon made it difficult to distinguish where the sky ended and the sea began.

meanings.definition: The act of leveling or making something level.
meanings.sent1: The levelness of the construction site required careful planning to avoid accidents.
meanings.sent2: The workers ensured the levelness of the wall by using a spirit level.
meanings.sent3: The levelness of the garden after mowing the lawn was satisfying to see.
meanings.sent4: His determination to achieve levelness in his skills paid off in the end.
meanings.sent5: The levelness of the playing cards on the table showed his attention to detail.
